title: Gene Kelly's widow Patricia Ward was unimpressed by Renee Zellweger's Judy
text:
She's already been tipped for awards glory following an acclaimed performance.

But Renée Zellweger's portrayal of Judy Garland in the titular biopic has failed to impress Gene Kelly's widow Patricia Ward, who said the film 'enforced' why the Singin' In The Rain legend did not want a film about his life.

Speaking on Thursday's This Morning, Patricia, 60, admitted that trying to replicate some of Hollywood's greatest stars such as Judy and Gene were 'impossible.'

Scroll down for video

Open: Gene Kelly's widow Patricia Ward has shared her dislike for Renée Zellweger's Judy, saying it 'enforced' why her late husband did not want a film based on his life

Patricia told Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford that before Gene's death in 1996, he asked that she never allow a biopic to be made about his life.

She also said that Gene and Judy were great friends, and despite the perception that she was Hollywood's 'ugly duckling,' Gene found the Wizard Of Oz star 'incredibly bright and sexy.'

When asked about Renée's highly-praised performance in Judy, she said: 'Gene was very specific in his request, he said, ''I never want a biopic,''

'The film for me, it sort of enforced that and why he made that decision.

Sensational: Renée has earned critical acclaim for her performances as Judy Garland, and is tipped for awards glory in 2020

Open: Appearing on Thursday's This Morning, Patricia explained that she feels it is 'impossible' to replicate some of Hollywood's biggest stars

Speaking out: On Judy she said: ''Gene was very specific in his request, he said, ''I never want a biopic.'' The film for me, it sort of enforced that and why he made that decision'

'People like a Judy Garland, Gene Kelly, Frank Sinatra, these are comments that fly through the air once. To capture that quality is virtually impossible.'

Renée has earned acclaim for her portrayal of Judy Garland, which came in the midst of her London performances in 1969, mere months before her death.

Patricia was a guest on the show to speak about a series of special screenings of Singin' In The Rain, 67 years after the film was first released.

The couple married from 1990 - when she was 31 and he was 77 - but Gene died six years later after suffering several strokes.

Iconic: Gene is most well-known for his performance as actor Don Lockwood in 1952's Singin' In The Rain

Mr and Mrs: Gene and Patricia married from 1990 - when she was 31 and he was 77 - but he died six years later after suffering several strokes (pictured in 1991)

Sweet: During the interview, Patricia also reflected on the day she exchanged vows with the star, revealing he gave her a sweet note which she then showed to Eamonn and Ruth

During the interview, Patricia reflected on the day she exchanged vows with the star, revealing he gave her a sweet note which she then showed to Eamonn and Ruth.

She said: 'I did bring, this is the note he left me the day we married and I just found this, I'm still unpacking the boxes.

'It says, ''This is is, you're stuck, love love your new husband.''

This Morning airs weekdays at 10:30am on ITV.
